purpose: Official channel for the unofficial HubSpot Developer Browser Extension <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension> Feel free to give feedback and join the repo to help make it even better!
text: set the channel description: Official channel for the unofficial HubSpot Developer Browser Extension <https://github.com/williamspiro/HubSpot-Developer-Extension> Feel free to give feedback and join the repo to help make it even better!
Well I went and did it

made the channel.

So - we should figure out a plan for who is publishing the extension to the chrome store. It’d be nice if we could all manage updates to it, but I have a feeling that’s not possible.

Maybe we make a google account that all 3 of us have access to? the scary part there is where do we store the login info, definitely not github(that would make it public)
set the channel topic: :fire:Extensions and Extension accessories.:fire:

Welcome <@UB7S6BJ8Y>, if you’re interested in contributing to the extension let us know we’ll add you on github.

Feel free to post any issues/feature requests. 

The browser extension is currently installable by downloading from github, we will be publishing to the chrome store hopefully this week. We just have to iron out some logistics
<@U8THBCFC4> can you do a really minor change to the page editor? in the edit modules panel, can you make it so the list items have a `data-custommod-id="[custom module id from design manager]"`

for the extension I was going to see about making it add a button to the list items which would enable a button for editing the module in the design manager.

Seeing as for you guys to implement this feature would take a bit of work, as only developers should ideally have this button it’d require you to add some special permissions or settings somewhere.

for us to do it would be fairly trivial, all of the users using the extension are developers. and we can easily create a UI for enabling/disabling the feature.
screenshot of what I’m talking about: <https://spin.d.pr/nZEhUz+>

Awesome news everyone! I’ve launched the extension into the chrome web store.
<http://spin.d.pr/Z61sgv>

I launched it so we could have this extension in the web store by tomorrow. 
The dark theme, and documentation shortcuts branch isn’t quite ready to go live so I went with the master branch, If i get time tomorrow I’ll finish off the necessary things to get those features into the live version of the extension.
I will also look into if I can add others who can admin this extension in the store
